78901234:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE REPORT
Bronchoscopic Lung Volume Reduction via Endobronchial Coil Placement

Date of Service: [REDACTED]
Patient: [REDACTED] "Pat" Thompson | DOB: [REDACTED] | Age: 72 | MRN: [REDACTED]
Institution: [REDACTED]
Attending Physician: CAPT Russell J. Miller, MC, USN
Fellow: LCDR Emily Rodriguez, MC, USN
Location: [REDACTED]

CLINICAL HISTORY:
This is a 72-year-old female veteran with severe homogeneous emphysema (GOLD Stage IV) who has failed maximal medical therapy including long-acting bronchodilators, inhaled corticosteroids, and pulmonary rehabilitation. Patient experiences severe dyspnea (mMRC grade 4) limiting activities of daily living.

RELEVANT IMAGING:
High-resolution CT chest demonstrates diffuse panlobular emphysema with destruction index >50% bilaterally. No significant heterogeneity id[REDACTED]. Fissural completeness not optimal for valve therapy (<80%).

PULMONARY FUNCTION:
- FEV1: 0.72L (28% predicted)
- RV: 310% predicted  
- TLC: 155% predicted
- DLCO: 25% predicted
- 6MWT: 185 meters

PROCEDURE INDICATION:
Bronchoscopic lung volume reduction via endobronchial coil placement given homogeneous emphysema pattern.

CONSENT: 
Informed consent obtained after discussion of risks including pneumothorax (5-10%), hemoptysis (5%), COPD exacerbation (10%), pneumonia, respiratory failure, and death (<1%).

PROCEDURE DESCRIPTION:
Patient [REDACTED] with standard ASA monitoring. Moderate sedation achieved with midazolam 5mg IV and fentanyl 150mcg IV titrated to effect. Additional topical anesthesia provided with 4% nebulized lidocaine and 2% topical lidocaine spray.

A flexible video bronchoscope (Olympus BF-1TH190) was introduced transorally using a bite block. Systematic airway inspection was performed:
- Vocal cords: Normal mobility
- Trachea: Mild tracheomalacia, no stenosis
- Carina: Sharp, mobile
- Bilateral airways: Patent, no endobronchial lesions

RIGHT UPPER LOBE COIL PLACEMENT:
Using fluoroscopic guidance and specialized delivery catheter:
- 10 RepneuCoils (125mm) placed in RUL segments
- Distribution: 4 in anterior segment, 3 in apical, 3 in posterior
- Each coil deployed with characteristic "pigtail" configuration
- Gentle tension applied to compress emphysematous tissue
- No immediate complications

LEFT UPPER LOBE COIL PLACEMENT:
- 10 RepneuCoils (125mm) placed in LUL segments  
- Distribution: 4 in apicoposterior, 3 in anterior, 3 in lingula
- Fluoroscopy confirmed appropriate positioning
- No vascular injury or pneumothorax

TOTAL PROCEDURE TIME: 95 minutes
FLUOROSCOPY TIME: 18 minutes
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: <10mL

IMMEDIATE POST-PROCEDURE:
Patient [REDACTED] recovery in stable condition. No oxygen desaturation. Chest radiograph obtained showing bilateral coils in appropriate position without pneumothorax or significant hemorrhage.

ASSESSMENT & PLAN:
1. Successful bilateral endobronchial coil placement (20 coils total)
2. Admit for overnight observation with telemetry
3. Incentive spirometry and chest physiotherapy
4. Prophylactic antibiotics (levofloxacin) x 5 days
5. Prednisone taper starting 40mg daily
6. Follow-up in clinic in 2 weeks
7. Repeat PFTs and 6MWT at 3 months

COMPLICATIONS: None

Russell J. Miller, MD, FCCP
Director, Interventional Pulmonology
